poem:
**Overturned**

Years collected like dust  
in a forgotten corner,  
as Sullivan watched his life  
unspool from a cell window,  
his name a faded memory.  
Now DNA, silent witness,  
whispers truth from preserved shadows,  
and time, stubborn river,  
at last bends its course,  
setting free a man  
caged by a mistake  
older than hope.
